text: Levi W. Barden (September 3, 1820 – August 31, 1915) was a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly and the Wisconsin State Senate. ==Biography== Barden was born on September 3, 1820 in Benton, New York. He graduated from State and National Law School and moved to Portage, Wisconsin in 1852. On November 29, 1853, Barden married Jane R. Corning. They would have three children. He died in Flushing, New York on August 31, 1915 and was buried in Portage. ==Career== Barden was a member of the Assembly in 1865. He represented the 27th District 1875 to 1876 and again in 1878. Other positions he held include Portage alderman, District Attorney of Columbia County, Wisconsin and justice of the peace. Barden was a Republican. ==References== Category:People from Benton, New York Category:People from Portage, Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:Wisconsin city council members Category:District attorneys in Wisconsin Category:American justices of the peace Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:State and National Law School alumni Category:1820 births Category:1915 deaths Category:Burials in Wisconsin
title: Levi W. Barden
